intro: Lasiodiscus mannii var. chevalieri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy surface, and the flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in clusters at the ends of the branches. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
